de.unifrankfurt.informatik.acoli.starling.types

Class StarlingWord

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unifrankfurt.informatik.acoli.starling.types.StarlingWord

  • public class StarlingWord
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for a word in a Starling dictionary. Actually its the representation of a XML proto or a cognate word. The unit word refers to lexical entries in a RDF lexicon.

    Example (Excerpt from Starling Turkic dictionary) :

    <record id="1236">
    <field name="NUMBER">1236</field>
    <field name="PROTO">*jɨĺ</field>
    <field name="PRNUM">2569</field>
    <field name="MEANING">1 mountain forest, thicket 2 spine</field>
    <field name="RUSMEAN">1 горный лес, чаща 2 хребет</field>
    <field name="ATU">jɨš 1 (Orkh.)</field>
    <field name="KRH">jɨš 'high ground' (MK)</field>

    Cognate ATU :
    word = jɨš
    bracketComment = (Orkh.)
    quotedComment =
    semReference = 1

    Cognate KRH :
    word = jɨš
    bracketComment = (MK)
    quotedComment = 'high ground'
    semReference =

    Author:
    frank

    • Constructor Detail

      • StarlingWord

        public StarlingWord()

      • StarlingWord

        public StarlingWord(int id,
                    java.lang.String t,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> qc,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> bc,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> sr)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        id - Integer number used for resource URI
        t - The proto/cognate word itself
        qc - Quoted comment, e.g. 'any comment'
        bc - Bracket comment, e.g. [any comment] or (any comment)
        sr - List of integers which are references to the meaning as defined in the XML MEANING and RUSMEAN fields
